pr_title: [CALCITE-4063] Unnest an array of single-item structs causes ClassCastException

timeline.bodyText: Should these all really be unordered? I'm not sure what other implementations do, but I would have expected array elements to remain in order (same for the tests below).
timeline.author: michaelmior
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,189 @@

+package org.apache.calcite.test.enumerable;
+
+import org.apache.calcite.config.CalciteConnectionProperty;
+import org.apache.calcite.config.Lex;
+import org.apache.calcite.test.CalciteAssert;
+
+import org.junit.jupiter.api.Disabled;
+import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
+
+class EnumerableUncollectTest {
+
+  @Test void simpleUnnestArray() {
+    final String sql = "select * from UNNEST(array[3, 4]) as T2(y)";
+    tester()
+        .query(sql)
+        .returnsUnordered(

replies.bodyText: If I am not mistaken, our UNNEST implementation keeps the order, however SQL standard says that UNNEST does not guarantee to keep order, that is why the "WITH ORDINALITY" exists. This the reason why returnsUnordered is used here.
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.message: [CALCITE-4063] Unnest an array of single-item structs causes ClassCastException
